project.teaser: The overall goal of SCALE-UP is to support regional multi-actor partnerships, consisting of private businesses, governments and policymakers, civil society organisations, and researchers in identifying and scaling-up innovative and sustainable bio-based value chains that build...
project.objective: The overall goal of SCALE-UP is to support regional multi-actor partnerships, consisting of private businesses, governments and policymakers, civil society organisations, and researchers in identifying and scaling-up innovative and sustainable bio-based value chains that build on regional resources. Through its approach, SCALE-UP will adapt, implement and evaluate tools to help regional actors to overcome the apparent bottlenecks towards fully exploiting bioeconomy potentials in their region. A four phase methodology will: i) establish existing knowledge and set the stage for further research, as well as creating six regional platforms with local stakeholders; ii) facilitate cross-regional transfer of knowledge and demand-driven capacity building, and provide support to multi-actor partnerships to carry out market assessments and business model designs; iii) create a pan-European ‘Community of Practice’ to facilitate sharing good practices and lessons learned across European regions; and iv) disseminate and exploit project results in collaboration with key stakeholders. In addition to the focus on increasing capacity and knowledge on the bioeconomy among relevant actors in the regions, a key feature of SCALE-UP is the business development programme to be applied by the local communities. With an emphasis on the principles of co-creation, transparency and open innovation, the project will provide advisory support to innovators and regional stakeholders to assess market conditions, elaborate business plans and identify compatible funding sources for 12 bio-based solutions.
project.title: Concepts, tools and applications for community-driven bioeconomy development in European rural areas
project.keywords: rural development, bio-based business models, small-scale solutions

article.title: Advisory support for sustainable bio-based value chains

result.title: Project website with internal and external areas
result.description: D6.1 represents the project website, which provides an introduction to the project’s concept and approach, presents the six case study regions, and serves as the project’s main communication platform. The deliverable covers Task 6.2.

details.authors: Duygu Celik; Silvia Caneva; Chuan Ma
details.publisher: F1000 Research Ltd (London, UK), on behalf of the European Commission.

result.title: Concepts, Tools and Applications for Community-driven Bioeconomy Development in European Rural Areas - The SCALE-UP Project

details.authors: Ma, C., Celik, D., Caneva, S., Ball, I., Janssen, R., Gerdes, H., Kiresiewa, Z. etc

result.title: Management and Quality Plan
result.description: D1.1 outlines SCALE-UP’s management structure, the roles and responsibilities of partners as well as the procedures for progress monitoring, quality assurance, project management as well as communication with the EC and periodic reporting. The report will also include a Gantt chart and a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) along with a schedule per task, related deliverables, and dependencies on other tasks as well as any responsible partner related sub-tasks. The deliverable covers Tasks 1.1 and 1.2.

result.title: Region-specific scientific information packages
result.description: D2.2 summarizes existing scientific and technological information on small-scale bio-based solutions for uptake by the regional SCALE-UP platforms. The deliverable covers Tasks 2.4 and 2.2.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SCALE-UP (Concepts, tools and applications for community-driven bioeconomy development in European rural areas)
result.teaser: The overall goal of SCALE-UP is to support regional multi-actor partnerships, consisting of private businesses, governments and policymakers, civil society organisations, and researchers in identifying and scaling-up innovative and sustainable bio-based value chains that build...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Plan for dissemination and exploitation including communication activities
result.description: D6.2 elaborates the project’s overall dissemination, exploitation and communication strategy. The deliverable covers Task 6.1.

result.title: Unlocking Bio-Based Potential: Assessing Biomass and Nutrient Availability for Sustainable Development

details.authors: Emilija Mihajloska, Pavlina Zdraveva, Vladimir Gjorgievski, Natasa Markovska, Alajdin Abazi
details.journalTitle: Journal of Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems

result.title: Conceptual framework and practical guidance for the design and implementation of participatory activities in the SCALE-UP regions
result.description: D1.2 elaborates the project’s conceptual framework and outlines approaches for context-specific stakeholder engagement in the six SCALE-UP regions. The deliverable covers Task 1.4.

result.title: Practice Abstracts – Batch I
result.description: D6.3 contains two practice abstracts associated to Deliverables 2.2 and 5.1. The deliverable covers Task 6.2.

result.title: Overview of regionally suitable bio-based solutions
result.description: D4.1 presents short descriptions of all the 12 bio-based solutions that have been identified as part of the stocktaking exercises in the six SCALE-UP regions. It will also provide an overview of the selection process including the total number of EoIs received, brief descriptions of the selection criteria, and a list of the organisations involved in the selection committee. The deliverable covers Task 4.1.

result.title: Data Management Plan - interim version
result.description: D1.6 represents the updated version of the Data Management Plan. This version will build upon and update D1.3 to reflect any newly identified data that were collected/generated during the project as well as any changes in data previously identified and/or the methodology and plans of SCALE-UP for sound and FAIR data management. The deliverable covers Task 1.3.

details.authors: Celik, D., Caneva, S., Ma, C., Ball, I., Janssen, R., Gerdes, H., Kiresiewa, Z., Bailet, N., Castillo Barrero, R., Ronchel Barreno, C., Mihajloska, E., Rull Quesada, K., Pammer, K., Dauwa, L., Wolkerstorfer, G., Feil, F., Groenestege, M., Kalla, B., Matis

result.title: Report on regional biomass availabilities, nutrient balances and ecological boundaries
result.description: D2.1 combines the results of three separate assessments on regional biomass potentials, nutrient availabilities, and status of the regional ecological systems. The deliverable covers Task 2.3

result.title: Training programme: content, structure and implementation guidelines
result.description: D3.1 presents a comprehensive training programme for regional stakeholders and practical implementation guidelines. The deliverable covers Task 3.1.

result.title: Data Management Plan – first version
result.description: D1.3 outlines the project’s strategy to make data generated within the project FAIR – findable, accessible, interoperable and re-usable. The deliverable covers Task 1.3

category.title: innovation management
category.displayCode: /social sciences/economics and business/business and management/innovation management

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
